helpdesk-ticket.subject: Issue with outlook and one note creddentials
helpdesk-ticket.description:
Matt was in at the helpdesk and i had an opportunity to take a look at his computer for a bit. He has the issue with outlook where it will check his name ok but not connect to his account and therefor he cannot use outlook to get mail but owa works.
Also he has the issue where his one note wont cloud sync correctly. Which I am fairly sure Thomas knows how to remedy.
He will be in between 730 and 1 on wednesday to have this stuff addressed.
helpdesk-ticket.description-html:
Matt was in at the helpdesk and i had an opportunity to take a look at his computer for a bit. He has the issue with outlook where it will check his name ok but not connect to his account and therefor he cannot use outlook to get mail but owa works. 

Also he has the issue where his one note wont cloud sync correctly. Which I am fairly sure Thomas knows how to remedy. 

He will be in between 730 and 1 on wednesday to have this stuff addressed.

helpdesk-note.body: I gave up on his outlook when it wouldnt work on the helpdesk computer either, as mike thinks this may be a microsoft issue. But we may want to jsut load office 2013 again or office 2016. I was fairly sure you got that onenote sync working by logging out of an account and logging into the actual msoe sso'ed account i jsut couldnt remember how. The kid was nice enough and willing to work around the issue vs having it reimaged so i figured we could fix his onenote at least.
helpdesk-note.body-html: I gave up on his outlook when it wouldnt work on the helpdesk computer either, as mike thinks this may be a microsoft issue. But we may want to jsut load office 2013 again or office 2016. The kid was nice enough and willing to work around the issue vs having it reimaged so i figured we could fix his onenote at least.

helpdesk-ticket.subject: MATLAB
helpdesk-ticket.description: Sir/Ma'am, I was in the middle of using MATLAB when I received the following popup. Now I'm unable to open/use the program. Thank you in advance, Matthew Hughes
helpdesk-ticket.description-html:
Sir/Ma'am,
I was in the middle of using MATLAB when I received the following popup. Now I'm unable to open/use the program.
Thank you in advance,
Matthew Hughes

helpdesk-note.body: He came to the desk to follow up. He explained that he had started the program at school, put the computer to sleep, and reopened it at home. I concluded that MatLab must perform periodic license checks, and since GlobalProtect was not running at the time, the check failed. I provided him the the sslvpn URL to download the latest version if he needed to.
helpdesk-note.body-html: He came to the desk to follow up. He explained that he had started the program at school, put the computer to sleep, and reopened it at home. I concluded that MatLab must perform periodic license checks, and since GlobalProtect was not running at the time, the check failed. I provided him the the sslvpn URL to download the latest version if he needed to.

helpdesk-ticket.subject: Lockout and Trust Relationship Error
helpdesk-ticket.description: User's account was locked out. I unlocked it. When attempting to log in, he received a variation on a trust relationship error message that I have not seen before. "The domain does not have a computer account for this trust relationship." - to paraphrase I applied the standard trust relationship solution; it worked.
helpdesk-ticket.description-html:
User's account was locked out.
I unlocked it.
When attempting to log in, he received a variation on a trust relationship error message that I have not seen before. "The domain does not have a computer account for this trust relationship." - to paraphrase
I applied the standard trust relationship solution; it worked.

Hi Eidlertj,
According to our records, your Hub account is still set up using an @yahoo.com email address. You will need to switch your Hub account over to your msoe.edu address. This should help you access your financial aid. You can do this by going to the following link:
https://www.msoe.edu/switcher_app/
Let us know if this helps.

helpdesk-ticket.subject: Potential Lockout
helpdesk-ticket.description: Kevin Brockman reported that his password wasn't working. I checked, and while there were incorrect passwords logged today, none were recent enough to have his account currently locked out, which it wasn't. Since the password had been changed 10 days ago, I hypothesized that a system, like a web browser cache, was still holding the old credentials.

I checked, and while there were incorrect passwords logged today, none were recent enough to have his account currently locked out, which it wasn't. Since the password had been changed 10 days ago, I hypothesized that a system, like a web browser cache, was still holding the old credentials.

helpdesk-ticket.description: He can log in to his domain account, network drives and global protect correctly, but msoe.edu, my.mose, blackboard and outlook are not accepting credentials.
helpdesk-ticket.description-html: He can log in to his domain account, network drives and global protect correctly, but msoe.edu, my.mose, blackboard and outlook are not accepting credentials.

helpdesk-note.body: No bad passwords are showing up when he is logging into any SSO service. Bad passwords do show up when he type a wrong password for his laptop.
helpdesk-note.body-html: No bad passwords are showing up when he is logging into any SSO service. Bad passwords do show up when he type a wrong password for his laptop.

helpdesk-note.body: sending to sys admin
helpdesk-note.body-html: sending to sys admin

helpdesk-note.body: I have his account quarantined. Can you confirm his laptop has no signs of the ransomware virus on it? Also you said he can get to network drives. Which ones? Did they map automatically or did you map them manually?
helpdesk-note.body-html: I have his account quarantined.  Can you confirm his laptop has no signs of the ransomware virus on it? Also you said he can get to network drives.  Which ones?  Did they map automatically or did you map them manually?

helpdesk-note.body: The laptop has been Dban'ed and imagined. No ransomware to be found unless it's living on an external device.The computer was capable of accessing the print share, neo, and I and I was told M, thought that hasn't been confirmed.
helpdesk-note.body-html: The laptop has been Dban'ed and imagined. No ransomware to be found unless it's living on an external device.The computer was capable of accessing the print share, neo, and I and I was told M, thought that hasn't been confirmed.

helpdesk-note.body-html: Have him bring his laptop back to the helpdesk and confirm he cannot access the M drive.  Thanks

helpdesk-note.body-html: he is coming to the desk soon

helpdesk-ticket.description: User is unable to log in to laptop
helpdesk-ticket.description-html: User is unable to log in to laptop

helpdesk-note.body: User's account was locked. Unlocked user account. Still could not log in. Restarted with ethernet cable.
helpdesk-note.body-html: User's account was locked. Unlocked user account. Still could not log in. Restarted with ethernet cable.

helpdesk-note.body: Unlock was successful. But user still could not log in. Reset user's password. User still could not log in. Unlocked and reset again. Verified that unlock and reset were successful. Restarting computer.
helpdesk-note.body-html: Unlock was successful. But user still could not log in. Reset user's password. User still could not log in. Unlocked and reset again. Verified that unlock and reset were successful. Restarting computer.

helpdesk-note.body: User still cannot log in. "Username or password incorrect"
helpdesk-note.body-html: User still cannot log in. "Username or password incorrect"

helpdesk-note.body: According to FIM, password was last set in February. Maybe my resetting his password isn't working? The password tool application verifies it is going through though.
helpdesk-note.body-html: According to FIM, password was last set in February. Maybe my resetting his password isn't working? The password tool application verifies it is going through though.

helpdesk-note.body: Logged in as Administrator. Verified he is connected to domain. User said he came in yesterday to fix a trust relationship issue. I saw that the name of the computer had been changed. Checked the ipconfig for the DNS server address. That seemed okay. I then flushed the DNS cache. User still could not log in.
helpdesk-note.body-html: Logged in as Administrator. Verified he is connected to domain. User said he came in yesterday to fix a trust relationship issue. I saw that the name of the computer had been changed. Checked the ipconfig for the DNS server address. That seemed okay. I then flushed the DNS cache. User still could not log in.

helpdesk-note.body: User was able to log on to the desk computer. This proves his account works, but there is something wrong with the computer. Tomorrow, he will come back in and we need to swap him in to a new computer.
helpdesk-note.body-html: User was able to log on to the desk computer. This proves his account works, but there is something wrong with the computer. Tomorrow, he will come back in and we need to swap him in to a new computer.

helpdesk-note.body:
Good Morning,
When installing Minitab from the network on the MSOE domain, it should prompt you to enter a license server. The license server will be minitablic.msoe.edu. Please let us know if you are able to enter the license server and start your Minitab installation correctly.
Have a good day. MSOE Information Technology Tier 1 Helpdesk Team Benjamin Mahon 414-277-7288 helpdesk@msoe.edu
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Good Morning,

When installing Minitab from the network on the MSOE domain, it should prompt you to enter a license server. The license server will be minitablic.msoe.edu. Please let us know if you are able to enter the license server and start your Minitab installation correctly.

Have a good day.
MSOE Information Technology
Tier 1 Helpdesk Team
Benjamin Mahon
414-277-7288
helpdesk@msoe.edu

helpdesk-ticket.subject: Fwd: Message from KMBT_223
helpdesk-ticket.description:
Email spam
-Brad
Begin forwarded message:
From: "Raju, Ravi" <rajur@msoe.edu<mailto:rajur@msoe.edu>> Date: March 14, 2016 at 10:03:29 AM CDT Subject: FW: Message from KMBT_223
Hello.
helpdesk-ticket.description-html:
Email spam 

-Brad

Begin forwarded message:

From: "Raju, Ravi" <rajur@msoe.edu>
Date: March 14, 2016 at 10:03:29 AM CDT
Subject: FW: Message from KMBT_223

Hello.

helpdesk-note.body: Dr. Meier and several others have reported receiving large amounts of emails similar to this one. I have the student at the desk with undeliverable emails like he is spamming. The example was from him.
helpdesk-note.body-html: Dr. Meier and several others have reported receiving large amounts of emails similar to this one.  I have the student at the desk with undeliverable emails like he is spamming.  The example was from him.

helpdesk-note.body: Who is the student sending them?
helpdesk-note.body-html: Who is the student sending them?

helpdesk-note.body: Ravi Raju is at the desk and we have reset his password using FIM portal. We are running malwarebytes on his laptop now.
helpdesk-note.body-html: Ravi Raju is at the desk and we have reset his password using FIM portal.  We are running malwarebytes on his laptop now.

helpdesk-note.body: Dr. Meier said Ravi Raju was sending them. Brad Shearer also received emails from Ravi and is the one used to create this incident. Ravi is currently at the desk
helpdesk-note.body-html: Dr. Meier said Ravi Raju was sending them.  Brad Shearer also received emails from Ravi and is the one used to create this incident.  Ravi is currently at the desk

helpdesk-note.body: Student's laptop probably should be disconnected from the network until malwarebytes is completed
helpdesk-note.body-html: Student's laptop probably should be disconnected from the network until malwarebytes is completed

helpdesk-note.body: he has signed a waiver saying he will not go on the network. it is at the desk. He is backing up his data and returning in the morning. he needs a C:\ drive reimage.
helpdesk-note.body-html: he has signed a waiver saying he will not go on the network. it is at the desk. He is backing up his data and returning in the morning. he needs a C:\ drive reimage.

helpdesk-note.body: His laptop is sitting by the left window. It is reimaged correctly and he will be back at the desk around noon. I do not know if there issues with his account being quarantined still but I will look into it before he comes back. He wants us to really make sure there is nothing weird about his email still.
helpdesk-note.body-html: His laptop is sitting by the left window. It is reimaged correctly and he will be back at the desk around noon. I do not know if there issues with his account being quarantined still but I will look into it before he comes back. He wants us to really make sure there is nothing weird about his email still.

helpdesk-note.body: Reimaged laptop. Malware should be gone. Getting user set up again. Making sure network works.
helpdesk-note.body-html: Reimaged laptop. Malware should be gone. Getting user set up again. Making sure network works.

helpdesk-note.body: Everything works. Closing ticket.
helpdesk-note.body-html: Everything works. Closing ticket.

helpdesk-ticket.subject: Sr. Meier and several others have reported receiving large amounts of spam email over the last few minutes.
helpdesk-ticket.description: I will attach an example of the emails being sent.
helpdesk-ticket.description-html: I will attach an example of the emails being sent.

helpdesk-note.body: user that is having emails sent from his box is at the desk. working on it
helpdesk-note.body-html: user that is having emails sent from his box is at the desk. working on it

helpdesk-note.body:
Hi meier, Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/6327
Thank you for reporting this to us. And apologies for the late reply. We have been looking into this and found it was one computer doing the spamming. We have since taken the computer off the network and this issue should not be happening anymore.
If you have not seen this since earlier today I am going to mark this as resolved so please let us know. Have a great day.
James Windorff Helpdesk Technician helpdesk@msoe.edu 414 277 7288
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Hi meier,

Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/6327

Thank you for reporting this to us. And apologies for the late reply. We have been looking into this and found it was one computer doing the spamming. We have since taken the computer off the network and this issue should not be happening anymore. 

If you have not seen this since earlier today I am going to mark this as resolved so please let us know.
Have a great day.

James Windorff
Helpdesk Technician
helpdesk@msoe.edu
414 277 7288

helpdesk-note.body: marking as resolved since information was given and the laptop is off the network
helpdesk-note.body-html: marking as resolved since information was given and the laptop is off the network

helpdesk-ticket.subject: O:/ Common folder missing
helpdesk-ticket.description:
I no longer see the “Common” folder on the O Drive. I have checked with other staff and they no longer see it either.
I’m wondering if this is an error or if it is being removed. If it is being removed, is it possible to replace it and notify all faculty and staff, so that we can make copies of documents we use before it is shut down?
[cid:part1.04020902.09050504@msoe.edu]<http://www.msoe.edu/welcome>Emily Vogel, CAP Assistant to the Chair Electrical Engineering and Computer Science (414) 277-7323 (414) 277-7465 (fax) vogel@msoe.edu<mailto:vogel@msoe.edu> [cid:image002.png@01D10820.14495160] <https://www.linkedin.com/edu/milwaukee-school-of-engineering-19680> [cid:image003.png@01D10820.14495160] <https://twitter.com/MSOE?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Eauthor> [cid:image004.png@01D10820.14495160] <https://www.facebook.com/milwaukeeschoolofengineering>

helpdesk-note.body:
Hi Mike –
I use it for various things throughout the academic year: student employment lists of students approved for federal work study, various forms, and some of my faculty had power points posted there for MSOE use. It looks like it was re-organized, as I now only see 4 sub-folders. So, I won’t be entirely sure what I’m not seeing until I need it again. :/ I was just concerned that it suddenly wasn’t appearing and there was no notification.
Thanks, Em
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Hi Mike –
 
I use it for various things throughout the academic year: student employment lists of students approved for federal work study, various forms, and some of my faculty had power points posted there for MSOE use. It looks like it was re-organized, as I now only see 4 sub-folders. So, I won’t be entirely sure what I’m not seeing until I need it again. :/  I was just concerned that it suddenly wasn’t appearing and there was no notification.
 
Thanks,
Em

helpdesk-ticket.description:

Kim Benson benson@msoe.edu
-----Original Message----- From: Hoffmann, Terry Sent: Sunday, March 13, 2016 8:19 PM To: Benson, Kimberly <benson@msoe.edu> Subject: Phone conference access

Terry

helpdesk-note.body:
Hi Terry,
You already have webex access. If you go to meeting.msoe.edu and log in with your MSOE email address and password you will be logged into our webex server. If you click downloads you can install the webex client and the productivity tools which make it so you can have outlook tie webex use to meetings. Otherwise you can just schedule webex use from the meeting.msoe.edu page.
Also if you join meetings in chrome there is a chrome extension you will have to install.
Let me know if you have any more questions.
Tony x7407

To: Benson, Kimberly <benson@msoe.edu<mailto:benson@msoe.edu>>
Subject: Phone conference access

Do you have the phone number and access code for me to hold a teleconference call (not video) for week 3. I need this to advise students on Blackboard. Had it last year but lost my past messages.
Terry
[#INC-6343]

helpdesk-note.body:
Hi Terry,
You are correct. If you just need a voice bridge you will have to setup a webex meeting and either invite everyone with it, which will send them the meeting info they need, or give out the dial in number and meeting number. The attendie number is just to tie a video user to a voice user, so if you aren't using video you can just have people enter any number. Having the video portal allows for desktop and file sharing as well so depending what you are doing it may have some value.
If you have less then 5 users you could just conference them together on your desk phone as well. The video phones have up to 6 total user audio bridge functionality built into them.
Let me know if there are any other questions.
Tony
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Hi Terry,

You are correct. If you just need a voice bridge you will have to setup a webex meeting and either invite everyone with it, which will send them the meeting info they need, or give out the dial in number and meeting number. The attendie number is just to tie a video user to a voice user, so if you aren't using video you can just have people enter any number. Having the video portal allows for desktop and file sharing as well so depending what you are doing it may have some value.

If you have less then 5 users you could just conference them together on your desk phone as well. The video phones have up to 6 total user audio bridge functionality built into them.

Let me know if there are any other questions.

Tony

helpdesk-ticket.description: CC244- Jon could not connect with HDMI, but could connect with the VGA cable. AV team - Please check to see if it's a cable to be replaced. Thanks! Pat Hurlbut
helpdesk-ticket.description-html:

Thanks!
Pat Hurlbut

helpdesk-note.body: I was unable to get into the cabinet with the D20 key. However, Jon was able to connect with AirMedia, and he was very happy about that. Still, we need to fix the HDMI capability tomorrow if possible.
helpdesk-note.body-html: I was unable to get into the cabinet with the D20 key.  However, Jon was able to connect with AirMedia, and he was very happy about that.  Still, we need to fix the HDMI capability tomorrow if possible.

helpdesk-note.body:
Hi Dr. Hopkins,
Today Ben Ehr, a student AV worker, and I worked on the HDMI in CC244. We discovered that the Crestron unit is programmed incorrectly, and we will have AVI, our Crestron Contractor, work on it when they are next on campus. In the meantime, the HDMI now works by choosing "PC" on the Crestron control panel. All of the other connections still work as they are labeled, with the Display Port and VGA connecting by choosing "laptop." In addition, we noticed the document camera was disconnected, so we fixed that as well. It works correctly by choosing "Document Camera" from the controller.
We will place a notice on the podium with these detailed instructions, and will have the controller reprogrammed as soon as possible. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. Also, I hope the Air Media wireless connection worked well for you.
Sincerely,
Andy Holmes Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/6348
CC244- Jon could not connect with HDMI, but could connect with the VGA cable. AV team - Please check to see if it's a cable to be replaced.
Thanks! Pat Hurlbut
Andrew M. Holmes, M.Ed Instructional Technology Technician Office: CC307 email: holmes@msoe.edu phone: x6765
On Mon, 14 Mar at 2:48 pm , hopkins <hopkins@msoe.edu> wrote:
CC244- Jon could not connect with HDMI, but could connect with the VGA cable. AV team - Please check to see if it's a cable to be replaced.
Thanks! Pat Hurlbut
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Hi Dr. Hopkins,

Today Ben Ehr, a student AV worker, and I worked on the HDMI in CC244.  We discovered that the Crestron unit is programmed incorrectly, and we will have AVI, our Crestron Contractor, work on it when they are next on campus.  In the meantime, the HDMI now works by choosing "PC" on the Crestron control panel.  All of the other connections still work as they are labeled, with the Display Port and VGA connecting by choosing "laptop."  In addition, we noticed the document camera was disconnected, so we fixed that as well.  It works correctly by choosing "Document Camera" from the controller.

We will place a notice on the podium with these detailed instructions, and will have the controller reprogrammed as soon as possible.  Thank you for bringing this to our attention.  Also, I hope the Air Media wireless connection worked well for you.

Sincerely,

Andy Holmes

helpdesk-ticket.subject: SolidWorks - problem with addins tools
helpdesk-ticket.description: A number of my students that recently install SolidWorks 2015, from the MSOE network installer, do not have access to many of the Addins tools that should be available according to MSOE's SolidWorks license. Specifically the SolidWorks Motion Addin. They need the tool active so that they can complete many of the assignments this quarter (2015-16 Spring). A quick internet search identified that following forum solution: https://forum.solidworks.com/thread/97769 We attempted it on one of the students machines, but since the SolidWorks Installer is "locked down" in MSOE's network install, we had to uninstall and then re-install SolidWorks because we did not have access to the "repair installation tools" that are part of the SolidWorks installer. This problem is affecting just about half of the students in my course. Dr. Farrow
helpdesk-ticket.description-html:
A number of my students that recently install SolidWorks 2015, from the MSOE network installer, do not have access to many of the Addins tools that should be available according to MSOE's SolidWorks license. Specifically the SolidWorks Motion Addin.

They need the tool active so that they can complete many of the assignments this quarter (2015-16 Spring). 

A quick internet search identified that following forum solution:
https://forum.solidworks.com/thread/97769

We attempted it on one of the students machines, but since the SolidWorks Installer is "locked down" in MSOE's network install, we had to uninstall and then re-install SolidWorks because we did not have access to the "repair installation tools" that are part of the SolidWorks installer.

This problem is affecting just about half of the students in my course.

Dr. Farrow

helpdesk-note.body:
Hi farroww, Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/6350
The our policy on solidworks recently is to clean the C:\ drive and wipe windows to start again. This does not affect the students files, just their programs. They will have to reinstall all of their programs. This fixes the issue with add ins.
If you could advise them to stop in, this generally takes about an hour and a half to complete.
James Windorff Helpdesk Technician helpdesk@msoe.edu 414 277 7288
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Hi farroww,

Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/6350

The our policy on solidworks recently is to clean the C:\ drive and wipe windows to start again. This does not affect the students files, just their programs. They will have to reinstall all of their programs. This fixes the issue with add ins. 

If you could advise them to stop in, this generally takes about an hour and a half to complete.

James Windorff
Helpdesk Technician
helpdesk@msoe.edu
414 277 7288

Dr. Farrow

Dr. Farrow
 
From: helpdesk [mailto:helpdesk@msoe.edu]
Sent: Thursday, March 17, 2016 11:36 AM
To: Farrow, Dr. William <farroww@msoe.edu>
Subject: Ticket Closed - [#INC-6350] SolidWorks - problem with addins tools
 
Dear farroww,

Your Ticket #INC-6350 - SolidWorks - problem with addins tools - has been closed.

We hope that the ticket was resolved to your satisfaction. If you feel that the ticket should not be closed or if the ticket has not been resolved, please reply to this email.

Sincerely,
MSOE IT Support Support Team

[#INC-6350]

helpdesk-note.body:
Hi Dr. Farrow,
I've got Solidworks installed on a test laptop. I want to make sure that I am looking in the right place for Addin tools. I went Tools -> Add-Ins. Then there are two sections "Solidworks Premium Add-ins" and Solidworks Add-ins". I do not see Solidworks Motion Addin in either. Before I contact Solidworks I want to make sure I am looking in the correct spot.
Thanks Mike Timm Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/6350 A number of my students that recently install SolidWorks 2015, from the MSOE network installer, do not have access to many of the Addins tools that should be available according to MSOE's SolidWorks license. Specifically the SolidWorks Motion Addin.
They need the tool active so that they can complete many of the assignments this quarter (2015-16 Spring).
A quick internet search identified that following forum solution: https://forum.solidworks.com/thread/97769
We attempted it on one of the students machines, but since the SolidWorks Installer is "locked down" in MSOE's network install, we had to uninstall and then re-install SolidWorks because we did not have access to the "repair installation tools" that are part of the SolidWorks installer.
This problem is affecting just about half of the students in my course.
Dr. Farrow
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Hi Dr. Farrow,

I've got Solidworks installed on a test laptop.  I want to make sure that I am looking in the right place for Addin tools.  I went  Tools -> Add-Ins.  Then there are two sections "Solidworks Premium Add-ins" and Solidworks Add-ins".  I do not see Solidworks Motion Addin in either.   Before I contact Solidworks I want to make sure I am looking in the correct spot.

Thanks
Mike Timm

helpdesk-ticket.subject: Battery Issue
helpdesk-ticket.description: I picked up a new computer this morning because my old one wouldn't turn on. The battery in this new computer isn't charging and so when I unplug my computer, it shuts down completely and has be fully rebooted. I've had it on the charger for about 45 minutes and it still says 0% available, plugged in, not charging. Please bring me a new battery to my office, 204 Grohmann. The laptop is an EliteBook 8570w. Thanks, Dr. Farrell

I picked up a new computer this morning because my old one wouldn't turn on.  The battery in this new computer isn't charging and so when I unplug my computer, it shuts down completely and has be fully rebooted.  I've had it on the charger for about 45 minutes and it still says 0% available, plugged in, not charging.  Please bring me a new battery to my office, 204 Grohmann.  The laptop is an EliteBook 8570w.

Thanks, Dr. Farrell

helpdesk-ticket.subject: 2 Issues
helpdesk-ticket.description:
Hi –
I’m having issues with my current setup of my laptop and monitor. When I close the lid for my laptop it signs me off the desktop and the laptop. If I leave the laptop open then it is OK.
My work-study student needs a new keyboard. The current one will not allow you to use the return key.
Thanks for your help.
Sue
helpdesk-ticket.description-html:
Hi –
 
I’m having issues with my current setup of my laptop and monitor.  When I close the lid for my laptop it signs me off the desktop and the laptop.  If I leave the laptop open then it is OK.
 
My work-study student needs a new keyboard.  The current one will not allow you to use the return key.
 
Thanks for your help.
 
Sue

helpdesk-note.body:
I got a usb keyboard from Peter and replaced the student user keyboard with the new unit and tested it as working.
Sue's computer had a windows update issue that cause power settings to change so I had to set the lid close when plugged in to "do nothing" so it wouldnt sleep her computer when she was using it as a desktop at her desk. Tested it ok.
helpdesk-note.body-html:
I got a usb keyboard from Peter and replaced the student user keyboard with the new unit and tested it as working. 

Sue's computer had a windows update issue that cause power settings to change so I had to set the lid close when plugged in to "do nothing" so it wouldnt sleep her computer when she was using it as a desktop at her desk. Tested it ok.

helpdesk-ticket.subject: S214 Smart Ink Program not opening on Podium Computer
helpdesk-ticket.description: Smart Ink program does not show up when he is logged into his account. It does in the Administrator account, but does not open. The physical buttons on the display also do not function. The pen input and Smart Notebook work fine.
helpdesk-ticket.description-html:
Smart Ink program does not show up when he is logged into his account. It does in the Administrator account, but does not open. The physical buttons on the display also do not function. 
The pen input and Smart Notebook work fine.

helpdesk-note.body: I went over with him today to see what he was doing. It looks like the side tool bar for the Smart Ink functions does not open at start up or at all. Can this be re-installed in any way?
helpdesk-note.body-html:
I went over with him today to see what he was doing. It looks like the side tool bar for the Smart Ink functions does not open at start up or at all. 
Can this be re-installed in any way?

helpdesk-note.body: Monday, I am going to try to wipe the user profile from the machine. When he logs back in, I'm hoping it loads the default applications on the computer. I will also go into the settings for the Podium to fix the physical buttons.
helpdesk-note.body-html: Monday, I am going to try to wipe the user profile from the machine.  When he logs back in, I'm hoping it loads the default applications on the computer.  I will also go into the settings for the Podium to fix the physical buttons.

helpdesk-note.body:
Hi gerow,
Thank you for your patience. We are re-imaging computers this summer, and the issue will be resolved. Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/6378
Smart Ink program does not show up when he is logged into his account. It does in the Administrator account, but does not open. The physical buttons on the display also do not function. The pen input and Smart Notebook work fine.
Andrew M. Holmes, M.Ed Ph.D. Candidate, UWM Instructional Technology, Information Technology Milwaukee School of Engineering University
Office: CC307 414-277-6765 414-312-1383 (cell) holmes@msoe.edu
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Hi gerow,

Thank you for your patience.  We are re-imaging computers this summer, and the issue will be resolved.

Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/6378
Smart Ink program does not show up when he is logged into his account. It does in the Administrator account, but does not open. The physical buttons on the display also do not function. 
The pen input and Smart Notebook work fine.



Andrew M. Holmes, M.Ed

helpdesk-ticket.subject: AV for Event #2016-00299
helpdesk-ticket.description:
Good afternoon – there is an EECS event scheduled for 3/21 in MPALL from noon – 1:00. Event # is 2016-00299. Dr. Durant has this request for the AV:
My only slightly unusual request is that I be able to plug my laptop audio into the room speakers (so the local guests can hear the students we’re Skyping in from Prague) – I’ll also be projecting onto the screen (slides and live video from Prague).
Please contact Dr. Durant if you have any questions.
Thanks,
Carole Kasprzycki Administrative Assistant Mathematics Department Electrical Engineering & Computer Science Department Milwaukee School of Engineering 414-277-7452
helpdesk-ticket.description-html:
Good afternoon – there is an EECS event scheduled for 3/21 in MPALL from noon – 1:00.  Event # is 2016-00299.  Dr. Durant has this request for the AV:

My only slightly unusual request is that I be able to plug my laptop audio into the room speakers (so the local guests can hear the students we’re Skyping in from Prague) – I’ll also be projecting onto the screen (slides and live video from Prague).
 
 
Please contact Dr. Durant if you have any questions.
 
Thanks,
 
 
Carole Kasprzycki

Mathematics Department

helpdesk-ticket.subject: Needs Access to O: Drive Off Campus
helpdesk-ticket.description: User would like to be able to access Business Folder, and needs to be able to access it when off campus.
helpdesk-ticket.description-html: User would like to be able to access Business Folder, and needs to be able to access it when off campus.

helpdesk-note.body: First, I'm confirming that she can access it normally. Then I am going to help the user set up GlobalProtect.
helpdesk-note.body-html: First, I'm confirming that she can access it normally. Then I am going to help the user set up GlobalProtect.

helpdesk-note.body: User does not have the network drives mapped. Sending to System Admin to make sure that she has access to these. Then this ticket should be sent back to Tier 1, so that we can call her, have her come in, and map the drives and set up GlobalProtect.
helpdesk-note.body-html: User does not have the network drives mapped. Sending to System Admin to make sure that she has access to these. Then this ticket should be sent back to Tier 1, so that we can call her, have her come in, and map the drives and set up GlobalProtect.

helpdesk-note.body: All faculty and staff get O, H & M drives mapped via group policy. If they are not mapping you'll need to figure out why her laptop isn't picking up group policy. It may not be domain join or she may need to log into it wired to get the drives to map
helpdesk-note.body-html: All faculty and staff get O, H & M drives mapped via group policy.  If they are not mapping you'll need to figure out why her laptop isn't picking up group policy.  It may not be domain join or she may need to log into it wired to get the drives to map

helpdesk-ticket.subject: Community website not correctly loading for Professor Gates
helpdesk-ticket.description: Professor Gates is trying to access her Community account after a recent password change. She is able to successfully log in with her new password, but the page that comes up just asks for her demographics information. When she clicks on the "My News" buttons and the "Faculty/Staff" buttons, she just gets linked to the demographics page. What is the cause of this? We tried logging in with multiple browsers and had the same issues. This was not a problem before the password change.
helpdesk-ticket.description-html: Professor Gates is trying to access her Community account after a recent password change. She is able to successfully log in with her new password, but the page that comes up just asks for her demographics information. When she clicks on the "My News" buttons and the "Faculty/Staff" buttons, she just gets linked to the demographics page. What is the cause of this? We tried logging in with multiple browsers and had the same issues. This was not a problem before the password change.

helpdesk-note.body:
Chaning,
Is this a problem you have heard of before? I am not sure why her account would have changed. Everything on the JIVE side is correct for a faculty/staff member.
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Chaning,

Is this a problem you have heard of before?  I am not sure why her account would have changed.  Everything on the JIVE side is correct for a faculty/staff member.

helpdesk-note.body: No, I haven't. If the settings for user type are correct, it may be a browser cache or group membership issue. I have no clue. Likely will need to troubleshoot in person.
helpdesk-note.body-html: No, I haven't. If the settings for user type are correct, it may be a browser cache or group membership issue. I have no clue. Likely will need to troubleshoot in person.

helpdesk-ticket.subject: Re: [#INC-5896] Laptop requests for MAGE League of Legends Tournament
helpdesk-ticket.description:
Hello,
Do to the possible instability of the setup that I wish to configure with these systems, It would be Incredibly preferential to get access to the systems at some time beforehand for a short period of time to test and confirm that the process is viable. If it the process is not viable, I would then have the ability to plan a contingency. I understand that this might not be possible, but it would be increadibly helpful.
Thank You, Jeffrey Koehler
On Tue, Mar 15, 2016 at 4:28 PM, helpdesk <helpdesk@msoe.edu<mailto:helpdesk@msoe.edu>> wrote: Hi koehlere,
Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/5896
I was able to speak with our superviser about this issue and he advised that it will be a week before we could get those to you. There are a couple of factors that affect this descision and if you have any questions please let us know.
We will inform you when the computers are available. Have a great day.
James Windorff Helpdesk Technician helpdesk@msoe.edu<mailto:helpdesk@msoe.edu> 414 277 7288<tel:414%20277%207288> On Thu, 25 Feb at 1:59 pm , koehlere <koehlerjj@msoe.edu<mailto:koehlerjj@msoe.edu>> wrote: MAGE would like to request 4 laptops for their LOL Tournament. Date of event: April 30 - May 1st 2016. they would like them a couple of weeks in advance to test them.
[#INC-5896]

Jeffrey Koehler

helpdesk-ticket.subject: Hi MSOE, your Dropbox account is closing in 90 days
helpdesk-ticket.description:
[https://cf.dropboxstatic.com/static/images/emails/glyph/glyph_34%402x.png]
Hi MSOE,
We noticed you haven't used your Dropbox account under helpdesk@msoe.edu in over two years.
Would you like to keep your account? If so, sign into Dropbox using helpdesk@msoe.edu before June 14, 2016.
Sign in to keep your account <https://www.dropbox.com/l/2shPvBC82L7gFoV90FwISY/login>
Click the button or go directly to https://www.dropbox.com/login
Recently used Dropbox but still received this email? If you recently used Dropbox, we’re emailing you about a separate, unused account. Compare the email address on the account you're actively using to the one in this email. Even the addition or removal of a period ('.') from the address indicates a separate account.
What’s going to happen to your account? Once your account is closed, you won't be able to sign in anymore or link any new devices. Your data will also be subject to deletion from the service.
If you have questions or need help with your account, please visit our help center<https://www.dropbox.com/l/KFmzNosN1xNIjrKrtesAiJ/help/9080> or contact inactives-help@dropbox.com.
Sincerely, - The Dropbox Team
________________________________
Protect yourself from phishing emails. We will never ask you for your password in an email. If you don’t trust a link in an email, go directly to the normal login page. Learn more about phishing and malware<https://www.dropbox.com/l/lHA9ubXdNOpuZUPNJruE5R/help/9113>
© 2016 Dropbox
helpdesk-ticket.description-html:
Hi MSOE,
We noticed you haven't used your Dropbox account under helpdesk@msoe.edu in over two years.
Would you like to keep your account?
If so, sign into Dropbox using helpdesk@msoe.edu before June 14, 2016.
Sign in to keep your account
Click the button or go directly to https://www.dropbox.com/login
Recently used Dropbox but still received this email?
If you recently used Dropbox, we’re emailing you about a separate, unused account. Compare the email address on the account you're actively using to the one in this email. Even the addition or removal of a period ('.') from the address indicates a separate account.
What’s going to happen to your account?
Once your account is closed, you won't be able to sign in anymore or link any new devices. Your data will also be subject to deletion from the service.
If you have questions or need help with your account, please visit our help center or contact inactives-help@dropbox.com.
Sincerely,
- The Dropbox Team

Protect yourself from phishing emails.
We will never ask you for your password in an email. If you don’t trust a link in an email, go directly to the normal login page. Learn more about phishing and malware
© 2016 Dropbox

helpdesk-ticket.subject: Account Disable
helpdesk-ticket.description: I received an email stating my account will be disabled in late April. I am still taking graduate classes and will be until maybe fall of 2017. This is the second time I got this warning and subsequently have needed to ask for help and confirmation that my account will not be disabled. Please take my email off the disable list or postpone it untl 2018, at which time I understand if you then take my undergraduate (mutchleg@msoe.edu) email down. Thanks! -Greg
helpdesk-ticket.description-html: I received an email stating my account will be disabled in late April. I am still taking graduate classes and will be until maybe fall of 2017. This is the second time I got this warning and subsequently have needed to ask for help and confirmation that my account will not be disabled. Please take my email off the disable list or postpone it untl 2018, at which time I understand if you then take my undergraduate (mutchleg@msoe.edu) email down. Thanks! -Greg

helpdesk-note.body:
Hey Greg,
This is a common occurrence. According to my database you are not currently enrolled in courses this quarter, which is why you are receiving that message about your account being disabled. Being a graduate student, you simply need to contact the registrar and have them enroll you in the "prevent account from being disabled" 1 credit hour class. This is something that the registrar controls, and once you are enrolled in that your account will not be disabled.
Have a great day!
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Hey Greg,

This is a common occurrence. According to my database you are not currently enrolled in courses this quarter, which is why you are receiving that message about your account being disabled. Being a graduate student, you simply need to contact the registrar and have them enroll you in the "prevent account from being disabled" 1 credit hour class. This is something that the registrar controls, and once you are enrolled in that your account will not be disabled. 

Have a great day!

helpdesk-note.body: updating to tier two
helpdesk-note.body-html: updating to tier two

helpdesk-note.body:
Hi Christopher Raebel,
Thank you for alerting us of this issue. We had a printer error in that lab yesterday, and could not find a reason. There might be a network issue in that room. We'll check more into it and let you know what we find.
Thank you, -Brad S Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/6430 The computers in the CC-71 computer lab are currently not connecting to the network, so I cannot log in on them. Could someone please take a look and reconnect them to the network? Thank you!
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Hi Christopher Raebel,

Thank you for alerting us of this issue. We had a printer error in that lab yesterday, and could not find a reason. 
There might be a network issue in that room. We'll check more into it and let you know what we find. 

Thank you,
-Brad S

Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/6430
The computers in the CC-71 computer lab are currently not connecting to the network, so I cannot log in on them.  Could someone please take a look and reconnect them to the network?  Thank you!

helpdesk-note.body:
Hi Christopher Raebel,
An IT network staff and I checked out the lab. This lab has been prone to odd issues with network. We were able to resolve the printer issue, and we were able to log into multiple computers with our network credentials.
If your issue still persists, please let us know, and give us specific times and dates that you are trying to log on. This way we can try to track down the issue further. Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/6430 The computers in the CC-71 computer lab are currently not connecting to the network, so I cannot log in on them. Could someone please take a look and reconnect them to the network? Thank you!
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Hi Christopher Raebel,

An IT network staff and I checked out the lab. This lab has been prone to odd issues with network. 
We were able to resolve the printer issue, and we were able to log into multiple computers with our network credentials. 

If your issue still persists, please let us know, and give us specific times and dates that you are trying to log on. This way we can try to track down the issue further. 

Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/6430
The computers in the CC-71 computer lab are currently not connecting to the network, so I cannot log in on them.  Could someone please take a look and reconnect them to the network?  Thank you!

helpdesk-ticket.subject: Student Picture Request
helpdesk-ticket.description:
As in the past, this is where I file my request to get copies of student ID pictures for my students to improve student-professor interaction. See attached form for wording and indicated student permission. If possible, I would like the students alphabetized, by section. So, I have 3 sections – PH2021-61, PH2021-71, CH201-32. I would like to get each section individually - either in separate files or one file in multiple pages/segments. Whatever you can do is appreciated. Thank you.
Sheila Barber usually does this for me, but I request it through the helpdesk.
Mitch Colton
helpdesk-ticket.description-html:
As in the past, this is where I file my request to get copies of student ID pictures for my students to improve student-professor interaction.  See attached form for wording and indicated student permission.  If possible, I would like the students alphabetized, by section.  So, I have 3 sections – PH2021-61, PH2021-71, CH201-32.  I would like to get each section individually - either in separate files or one file in multiple pages/segments.  Whatever you can do is appreciated.  Thank you.
 
Sheila Barber usually does this for me, but I request it through the helpdesk.
 
 
Mitch Colton

helpdesk-note.body:
Hey Jacob,
This might seem like an IT issue, but it is actually a Maintenance issue (different departments). But don't worry, I made the maintenance ticket for you. In the future in order to make a maintenance ticket, you just need to log into community, click on "My News" and then click on "Maintenance & Custodial" and create a ticket in their ticketing system.
Have a great day!
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Hey Jacob,

This might seem like an IT issue, but it is actually a Maintenance issue (different departments). But don't worry, I made the maintenance ticket for you. In the future in order to make a maintenance ticket, you just need to log into community, click on "My News" and then click on "Maintenance & Custodial" and create a ticket in their ticketing system. 

Have a great day!

helpdesk-ticket.subject: New employee set-up
helpdesk-ticket.description: Hello, Kristen Kubisiak will be starting at MSOE on Monday, March 21. She will need a laptop, preferably one with a CD drive. She'll need Microsoft Office and Adobe InDesign and Photoshop. She'll be printing to the Marketing printer \\printers\Marketing C654e Kristen will need Jenzabar access to check student and alumni records for FERPA restrictions, hometown news info, graduation years and degrees. Please assign her the phone number (414) 277-7116 and reset the password so she can establish her own. (x7116 is already on the phone that's in the office she'll be using.) Thanks! JoEllen Burdue
helpdesk-ticket.description-html:
Hello,
Kristen Kubisiak will be starting at MSOE on Monday, March 21. She will need a laptop, preferably one with a CD drive. She'll need Microsoft Office and Adobe InDesign and Photoshop. She'll be printing to the Marketing printer \\printers\Marketing C654e

Kristen will need Jenzabar access to check student and alumni records for FERPA restrictions, hometown news info, graduation years and degrees.

Please assign her the phone number (414) 277-7116 and reset the password so she can establish her own. (x7116 is already on the phone that's in the office she'll be using.)

Thanks!

helpdesk-ticket.subject: BlueBeam Program Download
helpdesk-ticket.description: Hello - I was looking for instructions for downloading BlueBeam software to my PC for use in teaching my class, CM250. Do I need to visit the IS/IT department or are there online resources for me to download the program?
helpdesk-ticket.description-html:
Hello - 

I was looking for instructions for downloading BlueBeam software to my PC for use in teaching my class, CM250.

Do I need to visit the IS/IT department or are there online resources for me to download the program?

helpdesk-note.body:
Hi Patrick Condron,
You can follow this link: http://support.bluebeam.com/downloads-and-updates/ and can install the version as you want for your use.
Write us back if it doesn't help.
Have a good day.
Arush Arora
IT Helpdesk Milwaukee School Of Engineering
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Hi Patrick Condron,
 
You can follow this link: http://support.bluebeam.com/downloads-and-updates/
and can install the version as you want for your use.

Write us back if it doesn't help.

Have a good day.

Arush Arora

IT Helpdesk
Milwaukee School Of Engineering

helpdesk-note.body:
Hi Patrick,
Bluebeam Revu 2015 is available via "Get Programs" for all CAECM faculty and students. It was purchase by Dr. Woo last March. The software installation package under "Get Programs" includes our serial number and product key for the software. Let me know if you run into any issues.
Thanks Mike Timm Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/6456 Hello -
I was looking for instructions for downloading BlueBeam software to my PC for use in teaching my class, CM250.
Do I need to visit the IS/IT department or are there online resources for me to download the program?
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Hi Patrick,

Bluebeam Revu 2015 is available via "Get Programs" for all CAECM faculty and students.  It was purchase by Dr. Woo last March.  The software installation package under "Get Programs" includes our serial number and product key for the software.  Let me know if you run into any issues.

Thanks
Mike Timm

Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/6456
Hello - 

I was looking for instructions for downloading BlueBeam software to my PC for use in teaching my class, CM250.

Do I need to visit the IS/IT department or are there online resources for me to download the program?

helpdesk-note.body:
Hi Patrick,
Here is a link to a document on the Hub on how to install the software. Its fairly straight forward
https://community.msoe.edu/docs/DOC-5646

I was looking for instructions for downloading BlueBeam software to my PC for use in teaching my class, CM250.

Do I need to visit the IS/IT department or are there online resources for me to download the program?

helpdesk-note.body:
Hi Arush Bluebeam software is available through "Get Programs". Also there is a document on the Hub on how to install it.
https://community.msoe.edu/docs/DOC-5646
I try and stay away from directly users to the vendors website to download software because what they download may not be what we are licensed for. Thanks Mike

Is it possible to give him a loaner laptop for his class during spring? Then, he could access to the programs he uses for his class.
Thanks,
Jeong

helpdesk-ticket.description: Hello, I teach TC-172 Desktop Publishing in the Mac Lab (R202). I have a critical issue as I teach the Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Photoshop, Adobe Professional, and Illustrator), and I cannot open those applications on the Macs in the Mac Lab. When you try to start the applications, a message prompt opens stating that legacy Java SE 6 runtime must be installed (see files attached). Please get this installed ASAP as I need it to run my lab class. Thank you, Dianne Bender General Studies
helpdesk-ticket.description-html:
Hello,
I teach TC-172 Desktop Publishing in the Mac Lab (R202). I have a critical issue as I teach the Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Photoshop, Adobe Professional, and Illustrator), and I cannot open those applications on the Macs in the Mac Lab. When you try to start the applications, a message prompt opens stating that legacy Java SE 6 runtime must be installed (see files attached). Please get this installed ASAP as I need it to run my lab class. Thank you,
Dianne Bender
General Studies

helpdesk-note.body:
we have a solution to this here is the version of java that needs to be installed https://support.apple.com/kb/DL1572?locale=en_US

helpdesk-note.body:
Merged from ticket 6593 Subject: Mac Lab Issue: Who manages the lab? Description: Apple Lab issues with software for Diane Bender. She opened ticket #6469 last Thursday. Any updates you can provide on this? She has class again this Thursday and really needs this software upgraded and available to her.
Kim Benson benson@msoe.edu
From: Bender, Dianne
Sent: Tuesday, March 22, 2016 1:21 PM To: Slayman, Beth <slayman@msoe.edu> Cc: Benson, Kimberly <benson@msoe.edu> Subject: Re: Mac Lab Issue: Who manages the lab?
Thank you, Kim!
Beth, I teach TC-172 Desktop Publishing in the Mac Lab, specifically the Adobe Creative Suite software (InDesign, Photoshop, and Illustrator). I have lab classes on Thursday nights 5-7 p.m. Last Thursday we started with InDesign. Although I verified Creative Suite is still installed on the Macs, I never opened the applications and found out right before class that legacy Java SE 6 runtime must be installed. I attached a screenshot of the message you receive when you try to open the Adobe applications.
I logged a Help Desk ticket immediately (#INC-6469). However, I am not seeing any progress.
I was able to adjust for last Thursday's class, but this Thursday and going forward, I really need to have access to the Adobe software.
Ideas/advice?
Thank you,
Dianne Bender General Studies
From: Benson, Kimberly Sent: Tuesday, March 22, 2016 10:39 AM To: Bender, Dianne Cc: Slayman, Beth Subject: RE: Mac Lab Issue: Who manages the lab?
Maybe talk to Beth Slayman. She may have some insight into helping you. I’ve copied her on this email.
Kim Benson
benson@msoe.edu
From: Bender, Dianne
Sent: Tuesday, March 22, 2016 7:53 AM To: Benson, Kimberly <benson@msoe.edu> Subject: Mac Lab Issue: Who manages the lab?
Hello Kim,
Who is managing the Mac Lab these days?
I logged a Help Desk ticket (#INC-6469) for an issue with the software I use in my class. That was last Thursday and I do not see any action being taken as of yet. If I contact the Mac Lab "manager" directly, I was hoping for my issue to be resolved sooner than later.
Thanks!
Dianne

helpdesk-ticket.subject: Laptop specifications
helpdesk-ticket.description:
Helpdesk:
Can you tell me if my laptop meets these specifications?:
• RAM: Minimum 2 GB for 32-bit Windows 7, 8.1 & 10; 4 GB for 64-bit Windows 7, 8.1 & 10 and Windows Server 2008 R2 & 2012 • CPU: Intel® dual core or equivalent AMD processor. Faster processors yield faster performance. • Free hard disk space: 4GB • Supported Operating Systems: Windows 7, 8.1, 10 (32- and 64-bit); Windows Server 2008 R2 & 2012 • Internet Explorer 9 or higher or the current version of Chrome or Firefox for Online Help • A sound card supporting 16-bit recording • A DVD-ROM drive for installation • Built-in microphone or a Nuance-approved microphone. See support.nuance.com/compatibility for more information
Thanks for your help!, Ted Fitzpatrick
[MSOE-U-BK_RD] www.msoe.edu<file:///D:\MyDocs\Documents\Marketing\www.msoe.edu>
Edward A. Fitzpatrick III Director of Planned Giving Milwaukee School of Engineering 1025 North Broadway Milwaukee, WI 53202 414- 277-7148 (direct) fitzpatrick@msoe.edu<mailto:fitzpatrick@msoe.edu>
[cid:image001.jpg@01D033FD.529E6880]
Visit us on Facebook<https://www.facebook.com/pages/MSOE-ALUMNI/111480305541458?ref=br_tf>, Twitter<https://twitter.com/MSOE?lang=en>, and LinkedIn<https://www.linkedin.com/edu/school?id=19680&trk=edu-hp-cta-uni> for news, updates, and more!
helpdesk-ticket.description-html:
Helpdesk:
 
Can you tell me if my laptop meets these specifications?:
 
·  RAM: Minimum 2 GB for 32-bit Windows 7, 8.1 & 10; 4 GB for 64-bit Windows 7, 8.1 & 10 and Windows Server 2008 R2 & 2012
·  CPU: Intel® dual core or equivalent AMD processor. Faster processors yield faster performance.
·  Free hard disk space: 4GB
·  Supported Operating Systems: Windows 7, 8.1, 10 (32- and 64-bit); Windows Server 2008 R2 & 2012
·  Internet Explorer 9 or higher or the current version of Chrome or Firefox for Online Help
·  A sound card supporting 16-bit recording
·  A DVD-ROM drive for installation
·  Built-in microphone or a Nuance-approved microphone. See support.nuance.com/compatibility for more information
 
Thanks for your help!,
Ted Fitzpatrick

helpdesk-note.body:
Hey Edward,
According to my database, you are assigned a HP EliteBook 8540w.
· RAM: Minimum 2 GB for 32-bit Windows 7, 8.1 & 10; 4 GB for 64-bit Windows 7, 8.1 & 10 and Windows Server 2008 R2 & 2012
You DO meet this requirement. You have 4GB on Windows 7 unless you have changed your operating system.
· CPU: Intel® dual core or equivalent AMD processor. Faster processors yield faster performance.
You DO meet this requirement. Your laptop has an i5, dual core processor.
· Free hard disk space: 4GB
You PROBABLY meet this requirement. You just need to look at "My Computer" and make sure you have more than 4 GB available.
· Supported Operating Systems: Windows 7, 8.1, 10 (32- and 64-bit); Windows Server 2008 R2 & 2012
You DO meet this requirement
· Internet Explorer 9 or higher or the current version of Chrome or Firefox for Online Help
You PROBABLY meet this requirement, but if not you can easily upgrade your browser. Here is a guide for Firefox. Here's Chrome information. I would recommend not using Internet Explorer, but if you need help updating that give us a call at x7288.
· A sound card supporting 16-bit recording
You PROBABLY meet this requirement. You have an integrated HD Audio card. We could not find a way to test this on your model.
· A DVD-ROM drive for installation
You DO meet this requirement, unless there is a physical problem with your DVD ROM
· Built-in microphone or a Nuance-approved microphone. See support.nuance.com/compatibility for more information
You DO meet this requirement.

You PROBABLY meet this requirement. You have an integrated HD Audio card. We could not find a way to test this on your model.

helpdesk-ticket.subject: FW: Blackboard Portfolios
helpdesk-ticket.description:
Peter Pfister Help Desk Coordinator 414.277.7202
From: Holmes, Andrew Sent: Friday, March 18, 2016 10:00 AM To: Harris, Benjamin <harrisbj@msoe.edu> Cc: Pfister, Peter <pfister@msoe.edu> Subject: Blackboard Portfolios
[cid:5a1d89f1-8f9b-4511-acfe-65a5e686e1fe]<https://msoe.box.com/s/5vwbrkxiks5p0cux20ps69ydka29yaq8>
Dear MSOE Faculty and Staff,
In this ongoing series, Andy Holmes, Instructional Technologist, under the production of Ben Harris, Director of Desktop Management, will be delivering technology tips and best practices. This is an effort to drive high levels of performance and to ensure that the staff and faculty have what they need for daily success!
Many instructors have expressed a need for digital portfolio management. Although there are some paid applications available online, a satisfactory tool is hard to come by. One solution is to use Blackboard. Since most students are familiar with the system, and many instructors are now utilizing Blackboard in the classroom, the portfolio assessment option is one that can provide a ready solution. Although the built-in tool is not the most artistic, it does do a wonderful job organizing and collecting artifacts; it is functional, if not creative.
In this short music video, to the tune of Adele's "Nevermind, I'll Find Someone Like You," Andy laments the difficulties instructors have faced in finding digital tools to use as a portfolio, but then takes solace in the fact that there is a tool in Blackboard that can do the job. Although he will probably not win a Grammy for this performance, he is happy to share his semi-acceptable singing voice with the MSOE Community!
From the Blackboard documentation...
Assigned Portfolios
* You can request that portfolios be submitted for course assignments. * On the Create Assignment page, expand Submission Details and click Portfolio Submission. * Optionally, choose a template students should use in their portfolio submissions. Assigned Portfolios and Inline Grading
* ​When a student has submitted a portfolio in response to an assignment, the portfolio is viewable in the assignment grading interface. Instructions on how to create your own portfolios can be found here<https://en-us.help.blackboard.com/Learn/9.1_2014_04/Instructor/030_Navigation/Portfolios/My_Portfolios>! A detailed screencast will be available on the Blackboard Best Practices course.
Respectfully,
Benjamin Harris Milwaukee School Of Engineering (MSOE) Director of Desktop Management 414.277.2253 / harrisbj@msoe.edu<mailto:harrisbj@msoe.edu> Submit a Service Request: helpdesk@msoe.edu<mailto:helpdesk@msoe.edu> / 414.277.7288 Twitter : @MSOEIT
"We are building a culture of Exceptional Customer Service"
helpdesk-ticket.description-html:
Peter Pfister
Help Desk Coordinator
414.277.7202
 
From: Holmes, Andrew
Sent: Friday, March 18, 2016 10:00 AM
To: Harris, Benjamin <harrisbj@msoe.edu>
Cc: Pfister, Peter <pfister@msoe.edu>
Subject: Blackboard Portfolios
 
 
Dear MSOE Faculty and Staff,
 
In this ongoing series, Andy Holmes, Instructional Technologist, under the production of Ben Harris, Director of Desktop Management, will be delivering technology tips and best practices. This is an effort to drive high levels of performance and to ensure that the staff and faculty have what they need for daily success!
 
Many instructors have expressed a need for digital portfolio management.  Although there are some paid applications available online, a satisfactory tool is hard to come by.  One solution is to use Blackboard.  Since most students are familiar with the system, and many instructors are now utilizing Blackboard in the classroom, the portfolio assessment option is one that can provide a ready solution.  Although the built-in tool is not the most artistic, it does do a wonderful job organizing and collecting artifacts; it is functional, if not creative.
 
In this short music video, to the tune of Adele's "Nevermind, I'll Find Someone Like You," Andy laments the difficulties instructors have faced in finding digital tools to use as a portfolio, but then takes solace in the fact that there is a tool in Blackboard that can do the job.  Although he will probably not win a Grammy for this performance, he is happy to share his semi-acceptable singing voice with the MSOE Community!
 
From the Blackboard documentation...
 
Assigned Portfolios
  • You can request that portfolios be submitted for course assignments.
  • On the Create Assignment page, expand Submission Details and click Portfolio Submission.
  • Optionally, choose a template students should use in their portfolio submissions.
Assigned Portfolios and Inline Grading
  • ​When a student has submitted a portfolio in response to an assignment, the portfolio is viewable in the assignment grading interface.
Instructions on how to create your own portfolios can be found here!  A detailed screencast will be available on the Blackboard Best Practices course.
 
 
Respectfully,
 
 
Benjamin Harris
Milwaukee School Of Engineering (MSOE)
Director of Desktop Management
414.277.2253 / harrisbj@msoe.edu
Submit a Service Request: helpdesk@msoe.edu / 414.277.7288
Twitter : @MSOEIT
 
"We are building a culture of Exceptional Customer Service"

helpdesk-ticket.subject: Broken and Not Working Equipment
helpdesk-ticket.description:
Hello I am teaching in two classrooms this term, and both classrooms have issues. In CC45 the projector is too light, and the only way to see the content is to turn off all the lights. This has students sitting in the dark. Which is not conducive for a Public Speaking course. Additionally, in GM 02 the projector does not work. This too causes problems for students who need to have visual aids for their projects. Is there any way that the lights or projectors in those two rooms can be fixed?
V/R Yazmene
helpdesk-ticket.description-html:
Hello I am teaching in two classrooms this term, and both classrooms have issues. In CC45 the projector is too light, and the only way to see the content is to turn off all the lights. This has students sitting in the dark. Which is not conducive for a Public Speaking course. Additionally, in GM 02 the projector does not work. This too causes problems for students who need to have visual aids for their projects. Is there any way that the lights or projectors in those two rooms can be fixed?
 
V/R
Yazmene

helpdesk-note.body:
Good Afternoon Yazmene Thomas,
I will be forwarding this to the A/V Team so they can look into the problem more at the beginning of next week.
Hopefully these issues will be resolved in a timely manner and cause you no further inconvenience or worry.
Have a great weekend! Thank You, MSOE Information Technology Tier 1 Helpdesk Team Benjamin Mahon 414-277-7288 helpdesk@msoe.edu
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Good Afternoon Yazmene Thomas,

I will be forwarding this to the A/V Team so they can look into the problem more at the beginning of next week.

Hopefully these issues will be resolved in a timely manner and cause you no further inconvenience or worry.

Have a great weekend!

Thank You,
MSOE Information Technology
Tier 1 Helpdesk Team
Benjamin Mahon
414-277-7288
helpdesk@msoe.edu

helpdesk-note.body:
Hi Yazmene,
You are correct that the projector in CC45 is very light. It is scheduled for replacement over the summer. Unfortunately, I think the solution here will be coming, but not until after this quarter is completed.
I went down to GM 02 to see what is not working. I could use all of the connectors, and the desktop system in there. I think I need more info about how you are connecting - which cables are you using? That will help me troubleshoot a bit more.
Pat Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/6494

This too causes problems for students who need to have visual aids for their projects. Is there any way that the lights or projectors in those two rooms can be fixed?
V/R
Yazmene

helpdesk-note.body:
Certainly. Let me capture the sequence in more detail. I visit DOC-1934 in version 49 of Chrome (on a Macbook running OS X version 10.11.3 with the VPN off, not logged in to MSOE web), click download, and then opened the file. When Word starts up, it requests authentication as shown in the 4:45:05 screenshot. I then click on the red button to close the authentication window and I get the second request (4:45:36 screen shot) for the CCSD department login. This is with Version 15.19.1 of Microsoft Word for Mac. Note that I’m at home (off campus). I tried downloading the document with both Firefox and Safari and I also tried downloading it while logged in to msoe.edu; in each case I still got the prompt for a password.
Just to see if this was happening for all pages, I took a look at https://community.msoe.edu/docs/DOC-5912 I was able to open that one with no extra prompts.
Let me know if there’s any information I missed!
Rob

helpdesk-ticket.subject: MSOE password reset
helpdesk-ticket.description: Hello again, A couple months ago, my password expired. You guys managed to fix and reset the password. I would have done it myself, but I was on vacation while the password expired, and I'm also studying abroad in Germany. Once again, my password expired while I was on vacation. I'm still studying abroad, so I can't exactly pop in at IT. I've seemed to struggle with the password resetting since I got here. Can you just reset the password to the bone stock Msoe-ID number-Birthday? That would be perfect. Let me know if you need me to do anything. Thank you, Anton Vogel
helpdesk-ticket.description-html:
Hello again,

A couple months ago, my password expired.  You guys managed to fix and reset the password.  I would have done it myself, but I was on vacation while the password expired, and I'm also studying abroad in Germany.  Once again, my password expired while I was on vacation.  I'm still studying abroad, so I can't exactly pop in at IT. I've seemed to struggle with the password resetting since I got here.  Can you just reset the password to the bone stock Msoe-ID number-Birthday?  That would be perfect. Let me know if you need me to do anything.

Thank you, 

Anton Vogel

Can you just reset the password to the bone stock Msoe-ID number-Birthday? That would be perfect. Let me know if you need me to do anything.
Thank you,
Anton Vogel

helpdesk-ticket.subject: Unique IP to office network connection for remote desktop access
helpdesk-ticket.description: Hello, I am looking to be able to remote desktop into my computer from off-campus. Doing so requires a unique IP address for my office network line (S304). Is it possible to get a unique IP address? Thanks, Steve Holland EECS Faculty
helpdesk-ticket.description-html:
Hello,
I am looking to be able to remote desktop into my computer from off-campus.  Doing so requires a unique IP address for my office network line (S304).  Is it possible to get a unique IP address?  

Thanks,
Steve Holland
EECS Faculty

helpdesk-note.body: Can Tier 3 take a look at this?
helpdesk-note.body-html: Can Tier 3 take a look at this?

helpdesk-note.body:
Dr. Holland,
If you can get me the current wired IP of your device, I can provide an IP address in that same subnet that you can use. If you can provide the MAC address of your IPv4 physical adapter, I can assign the IP to your MAC and you wont need to deal with manually setting it (use "ipconfig/all" in a command prompt to get the MAC).
Remember, the firewall will block all inbound access to internal IPs, so you will need to use VPN to remote to your desktop.
Thanks,
Paul Fabian
MSOE Director of IT Services
fabian@msoe.edu
(414) 277-2355
Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/6513 Hello, I am looking to be able to remote desktop into my computer from off-campus. Doing so requires a unique IP address for my office network line (S304). Is it possible to get a unique IP address?
Thanks, Steve Holland EECS Faculty
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Dr. Holland,

If you can get me the current wired IP of your device, I can provide an IP address in that same subnet that you can use. If you can provide the MAC address of your IPv4 physical adapter, I can assign the IP to your MAC and you wont need to deal with manually setting it (use "ipconfig/all" in a command prompt to get the MAC).

Remember, the firewall will block all inbound access to internal IPs, so you will need to use VPN to remote to your desktop. 

Thanks,

Paul Fabian
MSOE Director of IT Services
fabian@msoe.edu
(414) 277-2355

helpdesk-note.body:
Hi Paul, Thank you for the quick response!
Here is the information you asked for: IP address: 155.92.164.217 MAC address: A0-B3-CC-CD-D7-A7
Also – I am planning on getting a desktop computer in my office soon which would be my primary computer I’d need to remote desktop into – when that happens, can I just send over the new MAC address and have it setup?
Thanks for your help! -Steve
---------------------------------------------------------------- Steven Holland, Ph.D. Assistant Professor Electrical Engineering and Computer Science Dept. Allen-Bradley Hall of Science S304 Milwaukee School of Engineering 1025 N. Broadway Milwaukee, WI 53202 Tel: (414) 277-7376 ----------------------------------------------------------------

Hi Paul,
Thank you for the quick response! 
 
Here is the information you asked for:
IP address: 155.92.164.217
MAC address: A0-B3-CC-CD-D7-A7
 
Also – I am planning on getting a desktop computer in my office soon which would be my primary computer I’d need to remote desktop into – when that happens, can I just send over the new MAC address and have it setup? 

Thanks for your help!
-Steve
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
Steven Holland, Ph.D.
Assistant Professor
Electrical Engineering and Computer Science Dept.
Allen-Bradley Hall of Science S304
Milwaukee School of Engineering

From: helpdesk [mailto:helpdesk@msoe.edu]
Sent: Monday, March 21, 2016 10:01 AM
To: Holland, Dr. Steven
Subject: Re: [#INC-6513] Unique IP to office network connection for remote desktop access
 
Dr. Holland,
 
If you can get me the current wired IP of your device, I can provide an IP address in that same subnet that you can use. If you can provide the MAC address of your IPv4 physical adapter, I can assign the IP to your MAC and you wont need to deal with manually setting it (use "ipconfig/all" in a command prompt to get the MAC).
 
Remember, the firewall will block all inbound access to internal IPs, so you will need to use VPN to remote to your desktop. 
 
Thanks,
 
Paul Fabian
MSOE Director of IT Services
fabian@msoe.edu
(414) 277-2355

helpdesk-ticket.subject: No Internet on CC 3rd
helpdesk-ticket.description:
Daniel could not establish an internet connection on the CC 3rd floor. Network, but not internet.
I ran the 6to4remover utility, restarted the computer, and disabled/enabled the wireless adapter. Upon re-enabling the adapter, the computer established an internet connection.
helpdesk-ticket.description-html:
Daniel could not establish an internet connection on the CC 3rd floor. Network, but not internet.

I ran the 6to4remover utility, restarted the computer, and disabled/enabled the wireless adapter. Upon re-enabling the adapter, the computer established an internet connection.

helpdesk-ticket.subject: FW: Email List
helpdesk-ticket.description:
Who would I contact that could put together email list based on the criteria listed below?
Tara Caldwell Administrative Assistant Civil and Architectural Engineering and Construction Management Department 414-277-7301 Caldwell@msoe.edu<mailto:Caldwell@msoe.edu> http://www.msoe.edu/academics/engineering-undergraduate-programs/caecm-career-night/
From: Leitzke, DeAnna Sent: Monday, March 21, 2016 10:20 AM To: Caldwell, Tara-Joanne <caldwell@msoe.edu> Subject: Email List
Tara,
Could you please help me put together an email list of students that will be eligible for the CTU exchange program. This list should include the following students:
· All freshmen AE students
· All freshmen AE/CM dual major students
· Sophomore AE student who have a GPA of 2.9 or higher
· Sophomore AE/CM dual major students who have a GPA of 2.9 or higher
Ideally, I would need this list created every spring term after winter grades are recorded.
Additionally, in fall I will need a list created of Junior AE and AE/CM’s with GPA’s of 2.9 or higher.
Thanks!! DeAnna

helpdesk-ticket.subject: removing trend micro
helpdesk-ticket.description:
Is there a way I can remove TrendMicro from my school laptop? Up to now it’s just been annoying but ignorable (because it pops up messages about needing an update but cannot update itself), but now it just deleted a file that it thought was a virus even though it was just a plain-text MIME message. I would like to get this software off my computer before it deletes something critical.
Thanks.
Rob
helpdesk-ticket.description-html:
Is there a way I can remove TrendMicro from my school laptop? Up to now it’s just been annoying but ignorable (because it pops up messages about needing an update but cannot update itself), but now it just deleted a file that it thought was a virus even though it was just a plain-text MIME message. I would like to get this software off my computer before it deletes something critical.
 
Thanks.
 
Rob

helpdesk-note.body:
Hi Rob,
You can remove TrendMicro by going to Control Panel>Uninstall or change programs and selecting Trend Micro from the list.
Is there anything else I can help you with? Abby Griffin Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/6536
