helpdesk-ticket.subject: Re: MSOE Alumni Account Password Expiration
helpdesk-ticket.description:
FYI, your email above contradicts the change system: "Please follow the link below and reset your alumni password. The only requirement for the new password is that it is at least 8 characters long" [Inline image 1]
On Mon, Mar 21, 2016 at 5:05 PM, Milwaukee School of Engineering <helpdesk@msoe.edu<mailto:helpdesk@msoe.edu>> wrote: Your MSOE alumni account password will expire on April 15th. [MSOE Logo] [Milwaukee School of Engineering] <http://www.msoe.edu> Hello Nicholas Gorden,
In an effort to make password resets easier and more secure over the next few weeks you will be required to reset your password.
Please follow the link below and reset your alumni password. The only requirement for the new password is that it is at least 8 characters long. You can even set it to the password you currently use, as long as its 8 characters long. You will also be asked for an alternate email address; it is optional to provide it but once we get the self-service password reset portal setup you will be able to use that alternate email address to reset your password.
https://gapps.msoe.edu/alumni/update_password.php
The deadline to reset your password is April 15th. If you haven’t changed your password by April 15th you will need to contact the helpdesk<http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/> for assistance in resetting your password.
Getting everyone’s password reset is phase 1 of this project. Phase 2 will be getting our new self-service password reset portal setup. The new self-service password reset portal will allow you to setup security questions or use an alternate email to reset your password.
If you have any questions please contact the helpdesk at (414) 277-7288<tel:%28414%29%20277-7288> or by email at helpdesk@msoe.edu<mailto:helpdesk@msoe.edu>. Otherwise please reset your password as soon as possible and keep an eye for additional communication regarding our new self-service password reset portal.
Thank You MSOE Alumni Email Team
This email was sent by an automated process.
© Milwaukee School of Engineering 1025 North Broadway • Milwaukee, WI 53202-3109 (800) 332-6763<tel:%28800%29%20332-6763> / explore@msoe.edu<mailto:explore@msoe.edu>
helpdesk-ticket.description-html:
FYI, your email above contradicts the change system:
"Please follow the link below and reset your alumni password. The only requirement for the new password is that it is at least 8 characters long"


On Mon, Mar 21, 2016 at 5:05 PM, Milwaukee School of Engineering <helpdesk@msoe.edu> wrote:
Your MSOE alumni account password will expire on April 15th.
Hello Nicholas Gorden,

In an effort to make password resets easier and more secure over the next few weeks you will be required to reset your password.

Please follow the link below and reset your alumni password. The only requirement for the new password is that it is at least 8 characters long. You can even set it to the password you currently use, as long as its 8 characters long. You will also be asked for an alternate email address; it is optional to provide it but once we get the self-service password reset portal setup you will be able to use that alternate email address to reset your password.

https://gapps.msoe.edu/alumni/update_password.php

The deadline to reset your password is April 15th. If you haven’t changed your password by April 15th you will need to contact the helpdesk for assistance in resetting your password.

Getting everyone’s password reset is phase 1 of this project. Phase 2 will be getting our new self-service password reset portal setup. The new self-service password reset portal will allow you to setup security questions or use an alternate email to reset your password.

If you have any questions please contact the helpdesk at (414) 277-7288 or by email at helpdesk@msoe.edu. Otherwise please reset your password as soon as possible and keep an eye for additional communication regarding our new self-service password reset portal.

Thank You
MSOE Alumni Email Team
This email was sent by an automated process.

© Milwaukee School of Engineering
1025 North Broadway • Milwaukee, WI 53202-3109
(800) 332-6763 / explore@msoe.edu

helpdesk-ticket.subject: Error code 1 when changing alumni password
helpdesk-ticket.description:
Hi there,
I tried changing my password, and I got this message.
string(30) "Server is unwilling to perform" Error code 1 occurred while updating your account. Please contact helpdesk@msoe.edu<mailto:helpdesk@msoe.edu?subject=Error%20code%201%20when%20changing%20alumni%20password> for support.
I did enter a new password, nine characters long. I tried a few times, with the same result. Please advise what I should do next. :-)
Thanks! Matt
helpdesk-ticket.description-html:
Hi there,
 
I tried changing my password, and I got this message.
                                                                                                                        
string(30) "Server is unwilling to perform"
Error code 1 occurred while updating your account. Please contact helpdesk@msoe.edu for support.
 
I did enter a new password, nine characters long.  I tried a few times, with the same result.  Please advise what I should do next.  :-)
 
Thanks!
Matt

helpdesk-note.body:
Hi Hillary, Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/6559 Hello,
We would be happy to do that. It will be reset to the MSOE default password. The default password is as follows:
MsoeXXXXXXMMDDYY
Where XXXXXX is your MSOE ID number, and MMDDYY is your birthday.
Thank you for contacting us. Have a great day.
I just received the email asking to reset the passwords for the email accounts. However, I seem to have forgotten my password for my email (Hillary.Sinkenberg@alumni.msoe.edu) since I have not logged into it in a while (I have my email forwarded directly to my primary gmail account). Is it possible for you to reset the account password from your end?
Please call/email with any questions.
Hillary Cheske (nee Sinkenberg) sinkenbh@gmail.com 708-927-1834

hi, its not taking my credentials.  i tried both robert.grabow and my full email.  what's the next step?
Robert Grabow
414-524-9811
robert.grabow@alumni.msoe.edu
On 3/21/2016 5:04 PM, Milwaukee School of Engineering wrote:
Your MSOE alumni account password will expire on April 15th.
Hello Robert Grabow,

In an effort to make password resets easier and more secure over the next few weeks you will be required to reset your password.

Please follow the link below and reset your alumni password. The only requirement for the new password is that it is at least 8 characters long. You can even set it to the password you currently use, as long as its 8 characters long. You will also be asked for an alternate email address; it is optional to provide it but once we get the self-service password reset portal setup you will be able to use that alternate email address to reset your password.

https://gapps.msoe.edu/alumni/update_password.php

The deadline to reset your password is April 15th. If you haven’t changed your password by April 15th you will need to contact the helpdesk for assistance in resetting your password.

Getting everyone’s password reset is phase 1 of this project. Phase 2 will be getting our new self-service password reset portal setup. The new self-service password reset portal will allow you to setup security questions or use an alternate email to reset your password.

If you have any questions please contact the helpdesk at (414) 277-7288 or by email at helpdesk@msoe.edu. Otherwise please reset your password as soon as possible and keep an eye for additional communication regarding our new self-service password reset portal.

Thank You
MSOE Alumni Email Team
This email was sent by an automated process.

© Milwaukee School of Engineering
1025 North Broadway • Milwaukee, WI 53202-3109
(800) 332-6763 / explore@msoe.edu

helpdesk-ticket.subject: Insecure alumni password reset
helpdesk-ticket.description:
Alumni have expressed concern that using publicly available information any alumnus's password can be reset by a third party. Please see the attached image for an illustration from the MSOE alumni password reset website. Please advise on the security of this mechanism. Thank you.
-Prof. Eric Durant, EECS
helpdesk-ticket.description-html:
Alumni have expressed concern that using publicly available information any alumnus's password can be reset by a third party. Please see the attached image for an illustration from the MSOE alumni password reset website. Please advise on the security of this mechanism. Thank you.

-Prof. Eric Durant, EECS

helpdesk-note.body:
Good morning, Dr. Durant.
We appreciate you expressing your concern over the security of our alumni email system.
Our Alumni Email team is currently in the process of getting a new self-service password reset portal setup specifically for the alumni accounts. The process will utilize security questions and alternate email to make the process more secure. I hope that this has addressed any concerns you may have. Have a good day. MSOE Information Technology Tier 1 Helpdesk Team Benjamin Mahon 414-277-7288 helpdesk@msoe.edu
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Good morning, Dr. Durant.

We appreciate you expressing your concern over the security of our alumni email system.

Our Alumni Email team is currently in the process of getting a new self-service password reset portal setup specifically for the alumni accounts. The process will utilize security questions and alternate email to make the process more secure.

I hope that this has addressed any concerns you may have. Have a good day.
MSOE Information Technology
Tier 1 Helpdesk Team
Benjamin Mahon
414-277-7288
helpdesk@msoe.edu

helpdesk-note.body:
Michael: Hi Hillary,
Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/6559 Hello,
We would be happy to do that. It will be reset to the MSOE default password. The default password is as follows:
MsoeXXXXXXMMDDYY
Where XXXXXX is your MSOE ID number, and MMDDYY is your birthday. Thank you for contacting us. Have a great day.

helpdesk-ticket.subject: Re: MSOE Alumni Account Password Expiration
helpdesk-ticket.description:
I only get the "account credentials are invalid" message, not sure if I'm typing the password wrong or the new one fails a check. Please help.
Thanks!
On Mon, Mar 21, 2016 at 5:06 PM, Milwaukee School of Engineering <helpdesk@msoe.edu<mailto:helpdesk@msoe.edu>> wrote: Your MSOE alumni account password will expire on April 15th. [MSOE Logo] [Milwaukee School of Engineering] <http://www.msoe.edu> Hello Frederik Karsten,
In an effort to make password resets easier and more secure over the next few weeks you will be required to reset your password.
Please follow the link below and reset your alumni password. The only requirement for the new password is that it is at least 8 characters long. You can even set it to the password you currently use, as long as its 8 characters long. You will also be asked for an alternate email address; it is optional to provide it but once we get the self-service password reset portal setup you will be able to use that alternate email address to reset your password.
https://gapps.msoe.edu/alumni/update_password.php
The deadline to reset your password is April 15th. If you haven’t changed your password by April 15th you will need to contact the helpdesk<http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/> for assistance in resetting your password.
Getting everyone’s password reset is phase 1 of this project. Phase 2 will be getting our new self-service password reset portal setup. The new self-service password reset portal will allow you to setup security questions or use an alternate email to reset your password.
If you have any questions please contact the helpdesk at (414) 277-7288<tel:%28414%29%20277-7288> or by email at helpdesk@msoe.edu<mailto:helpdesk@msoe.edu>. Otherwise please reset your password as soon as possible and keep an eye for additional communication regarding our new self-service password reset portal.
Thank You MSOE Alumni Email Team
This email was sent by an automated process.

The deadline to reset your password is April 15th. If you haven’t changed your password by April 15th you will need to contact the helpdesk for assistance in resetting your password.

Getting everyone’s password reset is phase 1 of this project. Phase 2 will be getting our new self-service password reset portal setup. The new self-service password reset portal will allow you to setup security questions or use an alternate email to reset your password.

If you have any questions please contact the helpdesk at (414) 277-7288 or by email at helpdesk@msoe.edu. Otherwise please reset your password as soon as possible and keep an eye for additional communication regarding our new self-service password reset portal.

helpdesk-ticket.subject: MatLab Laptop for Senior Design
helpdesk-ticket.description: Prof. Tronca needs a laptop with MatLab installed for a senior project. This has been provided to him in the past for the same reason.
helpdesk-ticket.description-html: Prof. Tronca needs a laptop with MatLab installed for a senior project. This has been provided to him in the past for the same reason.

helpdesk-note.body: We're running this by Peter.
helpdesk-note.body-html: We're running this by Peter.

helpdesk-note.body: Any progress on this ticket?
helpdesk-note.body-html: Any progress on this ticket?

helpdesk-note.body:
So I gave this laptop to professor Tronca, gave him the administrator account info. He mentioned that he needs to be able to use Matlab when off campus with this machine, but he does not want to use his personal msoe account, as there will be students using it. We had him connect to Global Protect with his personal credentials while in the administrator account and it seemed to let him use Matlab perfectly. We are not sure if this will cause any problems while off campus. Dennis was pretty sure that there will be internet access where they are doing their testing, but he is not certain that they will be able to access it.
Is there a way for us to set up a special domain account for Tronca's activities that would have a specific Matlab license attached to it / the laptop? He mentioned that we had done this in previous years, but could not recall the account info.
tl;dr: Can we set up a special domain account for Tronca and his students to have access to an individual Matlab license? Also, what information do we need from Tronca?
He prefers to be contacted via phone, since he has trouble accessing his msoe email sometimes.
helpdesk-note.body-html:
So I gave this laptop to professor Tronca, gave him the administrator account info. He mentioned that he needs to be able to use Matlab when off campus with this machine, but he does not want to use his personal msoe account, as there will be students using it. We had him connect to Global Protect with his personal credentials while in the administrator account and it seemed to let him use Matlab perfectly. We are not sure if this will cause any problems while off campus. 
Dennis was pretty sure that there will be internet access where they are doing their testing, but he is not certain that they will be able to access it. 
 
Is there a way for us to set up a special domain account for Tronca's activities that would have a specific Matlab license attached to it / the laptop? He mentioned that we had done this in previous years, but could not recall the account info. 

tl;dr: Can we set up a special domain account for Tronca and his students to have access to an individual Matlab license? Also, what information do we need from Tronca?

He prefers to be contacted via phone, since he has trouble accessing his msoe email sometimes.

helpdesk-note.body:
Professor Tronca,
Our VPN acts as a secure gateway from the internet to reach MSOE resources. Because of this relationship, we can't offer a generic access account. However, we can provide a standalone license associated with the MAC address of your laptop. You can get the MAC by opening a command prompt and typing "getmac". If you can provide this information, we can provide a standalone license associated to your account.
Please let us know if we can provide additional assistance.
Paul Fabian
MSOE Director of IT Services
fabian@msoe.edu
(414) 277-2355
Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/6574
Prof. Tronca needs a laptop with MatLab installed for a senior project. This has been provided to him in the past for the same reason.
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Professor Tronca,

Our VPN acts as a secure gateway from the internet to reach MSOE resources. Because of this relationship, we can't offer a generic access account. However, we can provide a standalone license associated with the MAC address of your laptop. You can get the MAC by opening a command prompt and typing "getmac". If you can provide this information, we can provide a standalone license associated to your account.

Please let us know if we can provide additional assistance.

helpdesk-ticket.subject: projector in L308 intermittent operation
helpdesk-ticket.description: When I use the built-in PC and display the screen to Projector2, the projector displays the screen for a few minutes, and then the projected image blanks out. It intermittently displays the screen for a short period (anywhere from a few seconds to a few minutes) before blanking out again. Note: The control box indicates a signal present even when the projector displays a blank screen
helpdesk-ticket.description-html:
When I use the built-in PC and display the screen to Projector2, the projector displays the screen for a few minutes, and then the projected image blanks out. It intermittently displays the screen for a short period (anywhere from a few seconds to a few minutes) before blanking out again.
Note: The control box indicates a signal present even when the projector displays a blank screen

helpdesk-note.body:
Hi hornick,
Thank you for bringing this to our attention. I did check out the system today. The Crestron screen was doing something unusual, so I refreshed the system. Afterwards, there didn't seem to be any issues with either of the projectors with either the built-in PC or the laptop. There is a good chance that refreshing solved whatever issue was occurring. If it happens again, please let us know and we will check into it.
Best,
Andrew M. Holmes, M.Ed Instructional Technology Office: CC307 email: holmes@msoe.edu phone: x6765 Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/6579 When I use the built-in PC and display the screen to Projector2, the projector displays the screen for a few minutes, and then the projected image blanks out. It intermittently displays the screen for a short period (anywhere from a few seconds to a few minutes) before blanking out again. Note: The control box indicates a signal present even when the projector displays a blank screen
Andrew M. Holmes, M.Ed Instructional Technology Technician Office: CC307 email: holmes@msoe.edu phone: x6765
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Hi hornick,

Thank you for bringing this to our attention.  I did check out the system today.  The Crestron screen was doing something unusual, so I refreshed the system.  Afterwards, there didn't seem to be any issues with either of the projectors with either the built-in PC or the laptop.  There is a good chance that refreshing solved whatever issue was occurring.  If it happens again, please let us know and we will check into it.

Best,

Andrew M. Holmes, M.Ed
Instructional Technology
Office:  CC307
email:  holmes@msoe.edu
phone:  x6765

helpdesk-ticket.subject: L-311 projector
helpdesk-ticket.description: I was unable to get the projector system to function properly during my 11AM class today. The projectors would power on, but i could not get my laptop to connect (and display my laptop screen). I have used that projector since the beginning of Spring term (including yesterday), and it was worked properly up until today. I verified that my laptop can connect and display properly in a different classroom, so either there is a problem with the L-311 system or there is a user error I am unaware of.
helpdesk-ticket.description-html:
I was unable to get the projector system to function properly during my 11AM class today.  The projectors would power on, but i could not get my laptop to connect (and display my laptop screen).  I have used that projector since the beginning of Spring term (including yesterday), and it was worked properly up until today.

I verified that my laptop can connect and display properly in a different classroom, so either there is a problem with the L-311 system or there is a user error I am unaware of.

helpdesk-ticket.subject: MAGE Corner Wifi
helpdesk-ticket.description: The MSOE wireless access point connected to when connecting from the MAGE corner on the 3rd Floor of the CC provides a connection to the MSOE domain, but does not provide internet access.
helpdesk-ticket.description-html: The MSOE wireless access point connected to when connecting from the MAGE corner on the 3rd Floor of the CC provides a connection to the MSOE domain, but does not provide internet access.

helpdesk-note.body:
Hi havemeyerd,
We're still trying to locate the MSOE wireless AP we assigned to the area. It had been stored in the locked back room, but it has been missing from the network for several months. When we checked for it, it was physically missing, and not just unplugged. We've left the wired ports near MAGE live for now to ease in the issue of the missing network hardware, but it will take planning to run new network and properly mount a new wireless access point where it wont go missing again. We are still in the planning phases, and justifying costs. As the wireless network is at it's strongest in the center of the Great Room, we recommend using that area while we address this issue.
Paul Fabian
MSOE Director of IT Services
fabian@msoe.edu
(414) 277-2355
Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/6582 The MSOE wireless access point connected to when connecting from the MAGE corner on the 3rd Floor of the CC provides a connection to the MSOE domain, but does not provide internet access.
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Hi havemeyerd,

We're still trying to locate the MSOE wireless AP we assigned to the area. It had been stored in the locked back room, but it has been missing from the network for several months. When we checked for it, it was physically missing, and not just unplugged. We've left the wired ports near MAGE live for now to ease in the issue of the missing network hardware, but it will take planning to run new network and properly mount a new wireless access point where it wont go missing again. We are still in the planning phases, and justifying costs. As the wireless network is at it's strongest in the center of the Great Room, we recommend using that area while we address this issue.

Paul Fabian

(414) 277-2355

helpdesk-note.body: So is this ticket just going to remain in the pending queue then, until MAGE is moved?
helpdesk-note.body-html: So is this ticket just going to remain in the pending queue then, until MAGE is moved?

helpdesk-note.body:

helpdesk-ticket.subject: Mac Lab Issue: Who manages the lab?
helpdesk-ticket.description:
Apple Lab issues with software for Diane Bender. She opened ticket #6469 last Thursday. Any updates you can provide on this? She has class again this Thursday and really needs this software upgraded and available to her.
Kim Benson benson@msoe.edu<mailto:benson@msoe.edu>
From: Bender, Dianne Sent: Tuesday, March 22, 2016 1:21 PM To: Slayman, Beth <slayman@msoe.edu> Cc: Benson, Kimberly <benson@msoe.edu> Subject: Re: Mac Lab Issue: Who manages the lab?
Thank you, Kim!
Beth, I teach TC-172 Desktop Publishing in the Mac Lab, specifically the Adobe Creative Suite software (InDesign, Photoshop, and Illustrator). I have lab classes on Thursday nights 5-7 p.m. Last Thursday we started with InDesign. Although I verified Creative Suite is still installed on the Macs, I never opened the applications and found out right before class that legacy Java SE 6 runtime must be installed. I attached a screenshot of the message you receive when you try to open the Adobe applications.
I logged a Help Desk ticket immediately (#INC-6469). However, I am not seeing any progress.
I was able to adjust for last Thursday's class, but this Thursday and going forward, I really need to have access to the Adobe software.
Ideas/advice?
Thank you,
Dianne Bender
General Studies
________________________________ From: Benson, Kimberly Sent: Tuesday, March 22, 2016 10:39 AM To: Bender, Dianne Cc: Slayman, Beth Subject: RE: Mac Lab Issue: Who manages the lab?
Maybe talk to Beth Slayman. She may have some insight into helping you. I’ve copied her on this email.
Kim Benson
benson@msoe.edu<mailto:benson@msoe.edu>
From: Bender, Dianne Sent: Tuesday, March 22, 2016 7:53 AM To: Benson, Kimberly <benson@msoe.edu<mailto:benson@msoe.edu>> Subject: Mac Lab Issue: Who manages the lab?
Hello Kim,
Who is managing the Mac Lab these days?
I logged a Help Desk ticket (#INC-6469) for an issue with the software I use in my class. That was last Thursday and I do not see any action being taken as of yet. If I contact the Mac Lab "manager" directly, I was hoping for my issue to be resolved sooner than later.
Thanks!
Dianne
